definition: to change (appearance)/to change shape
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
manner/pattern/way/appearance/shape/classifier: kind, type
erhua variant of 變樣|变样[bian4 yang4]

sentences.english: Ah, what a difference a homegrown financial crisis makes.
sentences.chinese: 啊，一場國產的金融危機令一切大變樣。

sentences.english: I've been to China years ago and it has changed out of all recognition.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前我去過中國，中國已經大變樣了。

sentences.english: Static compression can induce degenerative-like changes in the intervertebral disc.
sentences.chinese: 靜態壓力可以對椎間盤造成退變樣改變。

sentences.english: Each spring, after he shaved it, he looked so different from before.
sentences.chinese: 等到春天，他一颳了臉，人就大變樣了。

sentences.english: But sometimes down through the years, the name was changed.
sentences.chinese: 但是有時候長期流傳下來的名字會變樣。

sentences.english: Now they all know (the fact) that China has been greatly changed.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們都知道中國大變樣這個事實。

sentences.english: One honest man can make a difference.
sentences.chinese: 有一個老實人就可以大變樣。
這樣，每個季節，你會感覺到自己變樣了。

sentences.english: You will be surprised at how quickly the world around you will change.
sentences.chinese: 你會驚訝地發現你周圍的世界會馬上變樣。

sentences.english: One honest man can make a difference .
sentences.chinese: 有一個老實人就可以大變樣。
有一個老實人就可以大變樣。

sentences.english: If one day, thanks to universe, We just love forever in the world.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一天宇宙都變樣，我們只求愛永在世上。

sentences.english: After years of eating excessively.he was terribly out of shape.
sentences.chinese: 長年喫得過多之後，他的身體極度地變樣。

definition: nonsense/ridiculous talk/hogwash
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
bird's nest
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
penniless
birch
voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
to exaggerate
sullen/to scowl miserably
to be completely unrelated to one another (idiom)/irrelevant
pinyin: feng1 ma3 niu2 bu4 xiang1 ji2

definition: to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
